text:
I think it's time for me to declare this publicly.

I was working towards being the first man on Mars long before Elon Musk started SpaceX and SRK became a NASA scientist in Swades.

-@warikoo

Knowing when to say no 
and saying it

is a life skill

-@warikoo

"I am excited for you"

= "I really want this to go well for you", if the person loves you
= "I can't wait to say told you so, when you fail", if the person hates you

-@warikoo

Spend a lot of time on Twitter?

It isn't always bad.
It isn't always good too.

Depends on what you get out of it.
And what it keeps you away from.

-@warikoo

Nothing teaches you better than teaching others.

-@warikoo

When trying to bring about positive change, we run after the good so aggressively that our mind and body craves for the bad!

Change only happens over slowly.
Over time.
Step by step.

-@warikoo

The day we start taking ourselves too seriously, the world stops doing that!

-@warikoo

A big piece i have seen missing in several startups is a clear, simple and compelling definition of 

Employee Value Proposition 
(EVP)

Why should anyone join you, as against someplace else?

-@warikoo

Simplest way of building trust 

Do what you say you will do!  
EVERY
SINGLE 
TIME

-@warikoo

You can be kind, while still being selfish.

-@warikoo

If you invest in something you don’t understand because others are doing it, it is not called investing. 

It is called FOMO!

-@warikoo

Someone helped you early on. 
But now they have turned toxic. 

Stepping away doesn’t mean you do not acknowledge what they did for you. 
It means you also care about what they are doing to you.

-@warikoo

The battle is in the mind.

-@warikoo

5 signs of a toxic job:
1. There is no respect or recognition
2. There is no progress
3. There are no role models for you
4. There is no personal space
5. There are no/poor financial incentives

1 sign of a happy job:
You look forward to show up for work

-@warikoo

Don’t waste your time on people who don’t value their time.

-@warikoo

I know not to reply, if the email or message starts with 

“Hi Ankur Warikoo”

-@warikoo

It is baffling how many times we dismiss the right message because of the wrong messenger!

-@warikoo

If someone gets access to our Twitter drafts, they will either brand us as an honest intellectual or an honest asshole.

-@warikoo

If being nice to people supersedes being truthful to people, you are not an effective leader.

-@warikoo

One skill everyone is advised to build is Selling/Sales.

That is partly true.

Sales is of 2 kinds
- Deterministic selling 
- Indeterministic selling 

It is indeterministic selling that trains you for life.

-@warikoo

Integrity and Curiosity

These 2 things solve for most things.

-@warikoo

Life is so much simpler when you stop explaining yourself to people and just so what works for you.

-@warikoo

It amazes me how when we say "I am going to write" what we usually mean is "I am going to type".

They are two very different things for me.

-@warikoo

We spend so much of your lives, trying to justify our actions to the world. 

If only we spent time searching for those who never needed any justification.
They would have done the same thing.

-@warikoo

The worst form of bureaucracy?
The one within us

"I am like this only"
"I can't do this"
"I am not going to change"

The most dangerous people are those that sit and do not wish to change.

-@warikoo

Anyone who makes you believe that you are stuck and you don’t have a choice, is your enemy!

-@warikoo

Some companies are so poor that all they can offer their employees is money.

-@warikoo

We do not believe most things that we should believe in, simply because they are "too simple".

-@warikoo

The best people I have worked with, always asked me 3 questions, in some shape or form

1. The task you have given me - what is it aimed to accomplish?
2. Do I have your trust, to focus on that outcome?
3. How well did I do?

-@warikoo

Hypothetically, if you lost your memory completely and you have NO idea who you are as a person, how many people will it take to "reconstruct" your present self?

-@warikoo

You can’t gain confidence if you operate with fear.

-@warikoo

When you catchup with friends after a really long time, you are basically looking at yourself in the past.

-@warikoo

Seeking validation is not a bad thing. 

Key is
1. Who are you seeking validation from?
2. What are you seeking validation on?

-@warikoo

Daydreaming about a destination is almost always bad.
Daydreaming about a journey is almost always good.

-@warikoo

The worst use of your time?

Comparing your life with someone else's!

-@warikoo

Feeling guilty that you are not managing your time well, does not make you manage your time well.

Just a reminder!

-@warikoo

We are living in an era of opportunities. 

This does not mean considering things that most others are not doing. 

It means exploring several other things that you would not have otherwise.

-@warikoo

A key component of consistency is authenticity.

If you do something that is not naturally you, you will always struggle with being consistent! 

The most consistent people in the world, are simply being themselves all the time.

-@warikoo

If you hate college because it’s not teaching you anything, change it’s purpose. 

Make it about networking, internships, public speaking, cold emails, starting up, pursuing hobbies. 

College can be awesome even if you you do not put pressure on it to educate you.

-@warikoo

You are a CA today. 
You do not have to be a CA forever! 

You are an engineer today. 
You do not have to be an engineer forever! 

You are a journalist today. 
You do not have to be a journalist forever! 

Do not define your future by who you are presently.

-@warikoo

Everything has a market. 

The question is how big is it 
and whether that matches your ambition.

-@warikoo

The right relationships will never stop you from growing. 

In fact they will be the reason why you will grow.

-@warikoo

By not appreciating someone for their vulnerability and truth, all we do is encouraging lying.

-@warikoo

For those who went to Delhi University, you will agree.
Nothing happens at Delhi University!

I didn't get anything out of college.
The only thing I got was my wife!

What did you get out of college?

-@warikoo

There is temporary discomfort in doing the unconventional.

There is permanent discomfort in living life as a template.

-@warikoo

Most of us think that if we had an aim or a goal, we would have reached someplace in life by now. 
And thus would have been happy. 

One of the biggest lies we believe in.

-@warikoo

If you are at peace with who you are and where you are in life, you cut out all the noise! 

While everyone still shouts, your peace silences all of them for you.

-@warikoo

The moment we are scared the most is when we get what we have been working for, all these years. 

Because now we can't hide behind any excuse!

-@warikoo

You know what’s a unicorn idea in India?

Selling popcorn and Pepsi when a car scratches another, in delhi!

-@warikoo

There is a difference between being aware of what all can go wrong and thinking that things will most likely go wrong. 

That may just be the difference between your motivation or the lack of it.

-@warikoo

Life becomes easier when you learn to accept the apology you never got.

-@warikoo

In 11+ years of hiring experience, the one thing I can say with confidence has a high correlation with success 

is curiosity.

-@warikoo

Consider doing things that make YOU happy

Not things that make you jealous when you see others do.

-@warikoo

Being calm is a skill

-@warikoo

Ask haters, what are 3 things they like about those they hate?
Ask lovers, what are 3 things they do not like about those they love?

If they can’t answer, then they are not just haters or lovers.
They are prisoners of their own ideas.

-@warikoo

People know of you because of what you have done.
They talk of you because of what you know.

-@warikoo

For the next 10 years, all I want to do is to build a company that people don’t think can be built!

-@warikoo

What you have built maybe a great feature but not a great product. 
Maybe a great product but not a great business. 
Maybe a great business but not a great institution. 

The journey of entrepreneurship is knowing the difference.

-@warikoo

Just finished "Autobiography of a Yogi"
.
.
.
.
.
Naaaaah
Just kidding!

-@warikoo

The one we were before we saw ourselves in a mirror, is the one we truly are!

-@warikoo

Success is a relationship you have with your own self.

-@warikoo

We cannot control our thoughts. 
We can only be aware of them.

-@warikoo

Consistently put yourself into situations others have only watched and admired

-@warikoo

You need to manage your fears. 
Once you manage them, your life will manage itself.

-@warikoo

Who is the person you would disappoint the most, if you failed?

Speak to them today - and free yourself from their expectations

-@warikoo

We aren't addicted to things.
We are addicted to the emotions that these things generate!

-@warikoo

I have met anyone who after being paid a compliment did not feel better.

-@warikoo

For a week, I converted my Time Management course into a "Pay whatever you want" pricing.

1,374 people bought the course
671 people paid Re.1

I asked 75 of them individually, "what was the logic?"
"It was the minimum price"

Customers are simple in their logic!

-@warikoo

Accepting or rejecting feedback is your choice. 

Making yourself aware of the feedback isn’t a choice. 
Awareness is a discipline!

-@warikoo

The most important skill for the future?

Ability to remain a student forever!

-@warikoo

Going to bed.

Share your favorite life lesson, for me to read, once I wake up after 8 hours.

Mine? 
If you don't ask, the answer is always no.

Good night :)

-@warikoo

If everybody minded their own business the world would go round a deal faster than it does.

-@warikoo

Building a startup definitely won’t be as easy or glamorous as you had expected at the time of starting up. 

But it will reveal so much to you about yourself, that you won’t wish the journey was different in any way.

-@warikoo

Every time I feel the urge to announce my plans, to declare cognitive victory, to jump to conclusions, I remind myself

You are what you do. 
Not what you say you'll do.

-@warikoo

“If I can’t trust you, it doesn’t matter how smart you are.”

The best advice I have ever got!

-@warikoo

Attitude >> Experience >> Education

The only hiring principle I know of.

-@warikoo

Most people still read their emails.
They just very rarely come across good ones
And when they do, they almost always reply. 

Cold emailing remains one of the most underrated skills in today's world.

-@warikoo

You are in the wrong relationship if it is your responsibility to keep the other person happy

-@warikoo

Just got an email with the subject line 

URGENT: Do you wish to be a CEO someday? 

I am still not sure what the urgency is, if the promise is “someday”?

-@warikoo

The best way to find new friends is to NOT search for friends or friendships. 

Build habits that set you up to interact with people. 
Say hi to someone new everyday.
Engage with people's content.
Listen to people

To find good friends is luck.
Give luck a chance.

-@warikoo

Ever wondered how much of what you call success was never defined by you?

Instead, imposed on you?

-@warikoo

Courage is possibly the most important quality of all

Courage not so much to win, 
but courage to be ok even if you don't win!

-@warikoo

You can quit your current unhappy job/college/course and "waste" a year or two

Or not quit and waste your life!

-@warikoo

If you are miserable in your current state and waiting for a safety net before you quit

then you are going to continue being miserable

-@warikoo

The most valuable investments you make, are hard to measure 

Your reputation
Your work ethics
Your trust quotient 

That is why most people invest in just money!

-@warikoo

We will never be able to answer "what if?"
We will only regret it!

-@warikoo

Some of the smartest people in the world are competing for your sleep time. 

You know what that means?

Your sleep is VERY IMPORTANT! 
to you AND to them

Don’t let them win!

-@warikoo

The most dangerous people in the world are not the ones who are ignorant. 

They are the ones who are ignorant and BELIEVE they are right!

-@warikoo

The most emotionally corrosive form of regret occurs when we fail to take action on something that matters
deeply to us.

- Roman Krznaric

-@warikoo

As long as there is someone above you, whose judgement of your skills determines your outcome

your growth will always be limited!

-@warikoo

I sleep between 9-930pm everyday
Because of which I have had to say no to a LOT of things

I have never woken up even once, wishing I had stayed up last night.

-@warikoo

I have a joke about starting up, but I own only 9% of it.

-@warikoo

The purpose of relationships is not to make you happy. It's to teach you how to be happy alone.

-@warikoo

Are you doing it 

because you need to? 
because you have to?
or because you want to?

-@warikoo

I’m more interested in who you are, rather than who you think you are.

-@warikoo

People don't change. They just reveal themselves. 

It's your responsibility to be with people who are worth your time.

-@warikoo

Entrepreneurship is the most brutal way to discover yourself

-@warikoo

It's easier to complain about the things you don't have, than to appreciate the things you do.

-@warikoo

It baffles me how so many people weave stories in their head about the likely reasons for someone's behavior
but they never ask!

Why wouldn't you ask?

-@warikoo

RT @warikoo: You think you have arrived if there is a bot account for your tweets, or a meme account or a troll account?

NO!

You have arr…

The biggest misconception people have is that they are the odd one out and everyone else is sorted!

-@warikoo

Most of us live our lives with blinders on.

Either convinced that there is no other way, or 
Fearful that we might find another way

Give luck a chance...

-@warikoo

The best intersection is 
- A lot of people want you
- There is only so much of you available

-@warikoo

One of the best things I did as a leader, was also the most non-scalable thing I did as a leader

Have lunch with a colleague everyday

-@warikoo

It baffles me how so many people weave stories in their head about the likely reasons for someone's behavior
but they never ask!

Why wouldn't you ask?

-@warikoo

The best intersection is 
- A lot of people want you
- There is only so much of you available

-@warikoo

Spend time with people who see you for who you are.

Not those who see you for who THEY WANT you to be!

-@warikoo

The three big ones in life are wealth, health, and happiness. 
We pursue them in that order, 
but their importance is reverse.

@naval 🙏

-@warikoo

If we always stopped to qualify WHO IS IT that is giving me feedback, we will lose out on a lot of valuable feedback!

-@warikoo

If you feel compelled to keep the world perpetually in awe of you or your life, then they own your life!

-@warikoo

Your success is the best middle finger display to your critics!

-@warikoo

Few things make me happier than reading a resume that has consciously chosen to not follow a template.

The experience/achievements/degrees don't matter.
The "act of rebel" is the resume itself!

-@warikoo

The worst leaders never take tough people decisions

-@warikoo

Here is a trillion dollar idea
Figuring out what people really mean when they say something to you!

-@warikoo

My most frequently used feature on GMail is "email templates"

My frequently used email template is "polite no"

-@warikoo

My wife and I met each other at 19. 
We eventually got married at 27. 

It wasn’t because “we are made for each other”
It was because “We grew with each other.”

-@warikoo

It is interesting how "free time" is looked down upon when young and is perhaps the only thing worth chasing as one gets old.

-@warikoo

Most of the conflict with our parents happens because they think you do not even understand them.

When the truth is, you just do not agree with them.

-@warikoo

There are 2 ways of living life

Everyone is different. 
Just because someone else did it, doesn't mean it applies to me.

Everyone is the same. 
If someone else did it, that means I can do it too.

-@warikoo

I get the most replies to my newsletter whenever there is a typo in there.

This isn't true for just newsletters.
This is true for life!

-@warikoo

You are young and want to contribute to society? 

You know the best contribution you can make to society? 
Be happy!

-@warikoo

Most of all sports is not played on the field.
It is played in the mind!

-@warikoo

If you are one of those who thinks that you do not select a job but a job selects you, 
then you will almost always be cribbing about your job!

-@warikoo

The hiring principle that helped us the most while hiring at nearbuy

Attitude >> experience >> education 

Found gems through this approach that we wouldn’t have otherwise.

-@warikoo

There is no need to be perfect to inspire others. Let people get inspired by how you deal with your imperfections. 

My biggest lesson as a leader!

-@warikoo

“The culture of any organization is shaped by the worst behavior the leader is willing to tolerate”
 
- Evan Williams

-@warikoo

Most people who want to start a business think they should quit their job and startup.

Not imo.
Work nights/weekends and test your idea out.

The minute you HAVE to make the startup work to make money, it is very different from "lets see if this even works?"

-@warikoo

Instead of worrying about what might happen, anticipate what might happen.

Our power to imagine is both a strength and a weakness.

-@warikoo

Had 3 talks today at companies based out of Bangalore, Hyderabad and Singapore. 

Cumulative audience of 1,300+

It is ridiculous how we take technology for granted. 

What a time to be alive!

-@warikoo

No! 
Netflix wasn't free this weekend.
You paid for it!

Not with money though :)

-@warikoo

At nearbuy we used to ask people who applied “you think you can an entrepreneur at work?”

I asked a candidate who had responded yes to the question, “how will you be an entrepreneur at work?”

“I will run a side business”

🤦‍♂️

-@warikoo

We are born with only two innate fears: the fear of falling and the fear of loud sounds.
EVERY OTHER fear is taught to us!

Think about that for a moment!

-@warikoo

Sorry to break your heart...

Somebody out there has ALREADY come up with the same idea, that you have!
Somebody out there is ALREADY working on the same idea, that you have!

Don't over-index on the idea.
Instead, find out what is it that they know that you don't.

-@warikoo

When young, don't park your money AND your time in "fixed deposits".

The upside can be huge.
Explore.
Take risks.
You have little to lose. A lot more to gain.

-@warikoo

Trust the wait. 
Embrace the uncertainty. 
Enjoy the beauty of becoming. 

When nothing is certain, anything is possible. 

- Mandy Hale

-@warikoo

Goals in life are of 2 kinds

Redemptions goals - those you seek because you want to redeem yourselves from your past

Progress goals - those you seek because they will make you a better person in the process

Most progress goals are redemptions goals in disguise.

-@warikoo

When we say "I don't know what I should do", very often we mean "I don't know if what I want to do will work!"

We almost always know what we should do...

-@warikoo

Apologize for your actions 
But not for who you are

-@warikoo

Do not show up to every argument you are invited to! 

Undeniable life hack for your peace.

-@warikoo

Told Ma that it’s time for them to get full time help. 

“You know me. Main aisi nahi hoon”

I have no idea what she means!

-@warikoo

What's the best compliment you have got?

-@warikoo

The best form of writing is the one that is written neither out of fear nor with the willingness to share.

-@warikoo

What’s the worst interview question you have been asked?

-@warikoo

When people ask me "is this going to work?" I share an invaluable life lesson.

"Only one way to find out"

-@warikoo

You won’t get out of laziness for something you don’t want to do.

-@warikoo

The day you stop racing is when you have won the race!

Bob Marley

-@warikoo

If you are authentic, if you are truly yourself all the time - you don't have any competition! 

No one can ever beat you, at being you!

-@warikoo

The best advice doesn’t instruct.
It provokes.

@scottbelsky

-@warikoo

You don't drown in a river by falling in it, you drown by staying immersed in it.

-@warikoo

A good question is not concerned with a correct answer.
A good question cannot be answered immediately.
A good question challenges existing answers.

A good question is one you badly want answered once you hear it.

-@warikoo

Knock Knock.
"Who's there?"
"We are"
"We are who?"

We are the choices we make, words we share and lives we touch.

-@warikoo

Remember our old phones?
The one we used to charge once and it lasted a week?

And today we have to charge our phones everyday. 
Simply because our phones are processing so much more!

I am not talking about phones.
I am talking about our lives! 

Charge yourself...

-@warikoo

We get good at whatever is it that we do everyday.

And that could also include complaining.

-@warikoo

Do not let anyone define YOUR success or failure!
That’s the best gift you can give yourself.

And the world WILL make it hard for you to get it.

-@warikoo

Losing your temper is a sign that you have a long way to go

-@warikoo

Gentle reminder

The lion in the circus is called well-trained. 
Not well-educated!

-@warikoo

The best way to predict your future, is to look at your day today.

-@warikoo

To correct our flaws, stop looking for them in others.

-@warikoo

If you chose to be vulnerable in a world that thrives on your self-doubt, you are automatically in the top 1%.

-@warikoo

Doing extraordinary things usually means reminding yourself constantly that you know nothing.

-@warikoo

A sale is made on every call you make. 

Either we are able to sell to them.
Or they sell to us the reason why they can't buy.

-@warikoo

Sympathy: I feel sorry for you

Empathy: I can understand what you must be going through

Respect: I admire the way you are handling this

Respect >> Empathy >> Sympathy

-@warikoo

Geniuses make us believe they happen rarely and they change the world,

Artists make us believe they happen everyday and that we can be them if we work hard enough.

Hunt for artists in life!

-@warikoo

The best gift you can the other person in a relationship, is to not rely on them for your happiness.

-@warikoo

The more you solve for today, the farther tomorrow gets.

-@warikoo

The courage to share what you know isn’t about what you know.

It is about how you feel about yourself.

-@warikoo

No one is useless. 
Everyone knows something you don’t.

-@warikoo

“Now you know how it feels” is almost always the worst way to show people where they went wrong.

-@warikoo

Spoke to a founder making the transition from starting up to scaling up.

My advice:
People who got you thus far may not be the ones who will take you ahead.

The moment founders face this reality and do something about it, is when they have truly grown!

-@warikoo

Focus on your current trajectory.
Not your current position.

@JamesClear

-@warikoo

You know what makes you a terrible salesperson? 
Silence from the other side

They don’t say anything. 
And you keep sweetening the deal. 

“Never make a decision for the other side”
@garyvee

-@warikoo

We have just one life.
Why live it with just one identity?

-@warikoo

Asshole founders don't build institutions.
They merely start and run companies.

-@warikoo

Most decisions in life are reversible.
But we assume them to be set in stone.

The second we think decisions are irreversible, we stop giving serendipity a chance!

-@warikoo

I think the MBA experience changed my life because I didn't go to @ISB_edu looking for a job, or a career, or a profession, or a function, or a company. 

I went to ISB looking for myself. 
I went to ISB looking for WHO AM I.

-@warikoo

Every time you stop from sharing what you know because "who will listen to me; I am nobody"

some nobody is sharing what they know and that becomes the "golden standard"

You have a moral responsibility to share.

-@warikoo

Everyday, I get 10+ emails with the words "I feel I will let my parents down" or "They just do not understand"

And then they ask for the prescription.
"What should I do to make them happy/understand?"

That, imo is the wrong question to ask.
Here is why...

-@warikoo

If you wait for people to be successful to learn from them, you will keep waiting forever!

-@warikoo

As adults, the single biggest hurdle to learning is pride!

-@warikoo

That thing that you still haven't finished and you are mad at yourself for not doing so?

It is simply because it is not a priority.
You think you still have time.

-@warikoo

We all know when something's missing in life. 

We may not want to admit it.
We may not want to come to terms with it. 

But hand on heart, we all know when something is missing.

-@warikoo

Respect doesn’t come from title. 
It comes from conduct.

-@warikoo

There is a big difference in saying thank you and feeling thankful.

-@warikoo

The decision that will hurt you the most is not making one, while waiting to take the right one!

-@warikoo

What is one thing you would love to learn in 2021?

-@warikoo

What you're good at and what makes you happy needn't be the same things.

-@warikoo

It is only when you understand what the customer needs, do you realize the power of offering it to them.

-@warikoo

If you think college didn't teach you anything, it is quite likely it never ever did!

They didn't change what's on offer because you joined.
They have been selling the same shit for years!
You were the one who bought into the idea of a college.
Not the other way!

-@warikoo

One great hack to let luck play an important role in your life?

Realize and accept that you do not deserve anything in life.

-@warikoo

RT @lukecannon727: On May 22 2020, I built @the_perell_bot to uncover some of @david_perell’s best stuff

Exactly one year later, we’ve got…

"Oh you are now going to tell me what to do? Have you looked at yourself?"

The biggest mistake people make is to reject the right advice because it comes from someone who didn't take the advice themselves.

-@warikoo

People look for people who are like them. 
We hunt down people who are like us. 
Because we want to feel comforted. 
We want to feel safe.

Do yourself a favour, and set the discipline of spending time with people who are nothing like you.

-@warikoo

To all those in their 20s/30s who hide the actual price of products from their parents...

I am 40 with 2 kids
Just bought something for mom, for 999
“I Got it, Ma”
“Awesome. How much?”
“Ummm. 799!”

This shit never ends, I am telling you!

-@warikoo

The trick to investing is not where to invest and how much.
The trick to investing is time.

-@warikoo

"Oh, that is quite rich coming from you!"
"Look at yourself first!"
"Wow! What gives you the right to say this?"

It is insane HOW MUCH value we attach to "who" is saying what, instead of "what" is being said.

-@warikoo

Output: What I am supposed to do
Outcome: What my output is meant to achieve

Own the outcome. 
Not the output.

-@warikoo

I read 100% of my emails

This single thing has perhaps contributed more than 80% to the opportunities I have got in life.

-@warikoo

To start the habit of reading books, read books that you will enjoy. 

Not books that the world thinks you should be reading!

-@warikoo

To teach the path, we first have to walk the path.

-@warikoo

Don't try to minimize your struggle
